YAMIASSU

Welcome to Yamiassu, a framework oriented to variables developed by APO Softworks to enhance content creation and edition at runtime.

We welcome you to our framework. Here we develop a better way to build your applications in a record time and make it fully customizable to any need you may have. Yamiassu comes from the brazilian indigenous language Tupi-Guarani, it means the great(a√ßu/assu) night(yami). Hence the theme of the style we created. You will find the conventions used by our team to make the best out of everything provided.

About our philosophy

We highly believe that less is more and that you shouldn't need to steep your eyes when using an application during the night. So sit back and enjoy the night sky.

Our color system

We modularly integrated the colors that are in the framework with the content, so they are not actually within each of the components. So they are easy to toggle and do not exponentially scale the size of the css file. There are two types of pre-configured colors that you can use: background and line. They both can be toggled interactive, that would enable you to place them on buttons or anything else that should interact with user events.

Notifications

Inline

Inline notifications are notifications that highlight parts of the text and blend with them.

Primary inline notification
Secondary gradient inline notification
Success image inline notification
Warning line inline notification

Alert

Alert notifications are the ones that appear in the screen as a modal and block the use of the rest of the content while opened.

Pop-up

Pop-up notifications are little boxes that appear on the edge of the screen to display temporarily something that interests you.

Visibility

You should inspect the html elements here, not everything will be visible at the same time. Since the objective here is to show how you can hide and display to users on certain occasions. You can also use CSS targetting to toggle conditional visibility.

Hide

Targetable object, write #hideme on the url to hide
Will hide on extra small size
Will hide on extra large size

Display

Targetable object, write #displayme on the url to display
Will display on extra small size
Will display on extra large size
